verses.verse: Elihu then proceeded further and said:
“Be patient a little longer while I instruct you, for I have more to say on God’s behalf.
I will take my knowledge from afar to support my assertion that my Master is just.
I promise that there will be no flaws in my arguments; I come before you as a man of sound learning.
“God is mighty and does not recant; he is great because of firmness of heart.
He does not let the wicked live on in all vigor and renders justice to the afflicted.
He does not withdraw his eyes from the righteous, but he seats them forever with kings on the throne, and they are exalted forever.
“He will also have sinners fettered with chains and held fast by the bonds of affliction
after having denounced their conduct and the sins of pride that they have committed.
He opens their ears to correction, commanding them to turn back from their evil ways.
“If they obey and once again serve him, they will live out their days in prosperity, and their years will pass pleasantly.
But if they do not obey him, they will cross the river of death and die as a result of their stubbornness.
Those whose hearts turn away from God rage against him, and they do not cry for help when he chains them.
They die in the bloom of their youth after a dissolute life.
But God rescues the suffering from their affliction, employing their distress to instruct them.
“He also seeks to snatch you from torment. When you were enjoying a life of comfort with abundant riches and plenteous food,
you refused to bring the wicked to trial or to uphold the rights of the orphan.
Beware lest abundance cloud your judgment and that you not be corrupted by lavish gifts.
Bring the powerful to justice, not merely the poor, those who are powerful, not only the weak.
“Do not long for the night when you can drag people away from their homes.
Take care not to turn to evil; that is why you are now being tested by affliction.
“Behold, God is exalted in his power. What teacher can equal him?
Who has prescribed the course he should follow? Who can dare to say to him, ‘You have done wrong’?
“Therefore, remember to extol his work which men have always praised in song.
All men can behold it, admiring it from afar.
God is so great that he is beyond our understanding; the number of his years is past counting.
“It is God who draws up drops of water that he distills as rain to the streams.
His rain clouds pour down and provide abundant water for mankind.
“Can anyone fathom how he spreads the clouds as the carpeting of his tent?
Behold how he scatters his lightning and covers the depths of the sea.
This is how he nourishes the nations, providing food for them in abundance.
He holds the lightning in his hands and commands it to strike the designated mark.
His thunder warns us of his coming as he prepares for combat against iniquity.
